intro: Matricaria valentina, commonly known as the sweet William, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its clustered, showy yellow flowers that resemble daisies, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Matricaria valentina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in herbal medicine for its mild sedative properties.
